The claim originated from a viral video: where a person alleged that ballots marked with Sharpie pens were being invalidated.
The video: however, provided no evidence to support the claim and only showed one person repeating the allegation.
County and state officials: including Secretary of State Katie Hobbs, clarified that all ballots, regardless of the pen used, would be counted. They emphasized that there was no merit to the conspiracy theory that Republican ballots were being invalidated.
The Maricopa County Recorder: s Office had previously stated that fine tip Sharpies were recommended for use in polling places because they dried quickly and worked best with the tabulation equipment. This fact was also reiterated on Election Day through social media posts by the recorder's office.
